title: Couples Therapy
description:
Don't miss a special edition of Couples Therapy with the Push Comedy Theater's greatest couple... Sean Devereux and Bradford McMurran.

------

You think your relationship has problems?!?

In Couples Therapy you'll meet a couple on the rocks... be it newlyweds on a honeymoon from hell or an elderly couple at the end of their rope.Based on an audience suggestion, they take you on a roller coaster ride of emotions as they whisk you the trials and tribulations of couple they create right before your eyes.

Oh yeah, and they do it all in a single, 25 minute long improvised scene.

Two Improvisers... One Scene!!!

Couples Therapy... is sometimes hilarious, sometimes poignant, always magical.

Couples Therapy with Alan Johnson and the Alan Johnson QuintetFriday, November 23rd at 8pmTickets are $5

The Push Comedy Theater only has 99 seats, so we recommend you get your tickets in advance.

Free parking available behind Slone Chiropractic (111 W Virginia Beach) just one block from the theater. There is also limited parking on the street.

title: The Improv Riot: The Short Form Improv Show
description:
Get ready for short form (Whose Line is it Anyway?) improv at the Push Comedy Theater.

You demanded it! So now it's here!!! Our very own short form improv show. All the fun of Whose Line is it Anyway... right here in Downtown Norfolk.

The Improv Riot: The Short Form Improv Show

The last Friday of every month, 8pm

The Push Comedy Theater is a 99 seat venue in the heart of Norfolk's brand new Arts District. Founded by local comedy group The Pushers, the Push Comedy Theater is dedicated to bringing you live comedy from the best local and national acts.

Whether you're a die-hard comedy lover or a casual fan... a seasoned performer or someone who's never stepped foot on stage... the Push Comedy Theater has something for you.

title: Date Night: With Brad McMurran and Alba Woolard
description:
Get ready as we improvise your relationship.

It's the most fun you'll ever have on date night!

Two lucky couples will see their love unfold on stage through the interpretation of 2 of Hampton Roads' wackiest improvisers!

The couples will be selected at random and interviewed on stage in front of the audience. Using the information they learn, and their imagination, Brad and Alba will show the story of the couples' love.

For years, The Pushers have been getting to know diverse couples all across Hampton Roads with this signature piece. Normally this is a piece within a larger show. This time, Brad and Alba are out to explore as much as possible by bringing it to you as its own show!



Date Night: With Brad and Alba

Friday, December 7th at 8pm

Tickets are $10

---

The Pushers are Virginia's premiere sketch and improv comedy group. For more than 11 years they have thrilled (and shocked) audiences with their wild antics both on and off stage. The group puts on a racy, high-octane, energetic show that is guaranteed to have audiences howling with laughter. In November of 2014, they opened their own theater, The Push Comedy Theater, located in the new Norfolk Arts District.

In 2013 The Pushers' Off-Broadway musical Cuff Me: The Unauthorized Fifty Shades of Grey Musical Parody debuted in New York City. It ran for over a year in both New York and Chicago. A third production is currently touring the country.

The Pushers have appeared at both The Charleston Comedy Festival and The North Carolina Comedy Arts Festival. In New York, they have performed at The People's Improv Theater, The Upright Citizen's Brigade and at The Kraine Theater in New York's East Village.

Here in Hampton Roads the group have performed most notably at The Jewish Mother, The NorVa and The Virginia Beach Funnybone.

---

title: Push Comedy Class Voucher
description:
Give the gift of Push Comedy this holiday season!

In addition to our weekly shows we also teach classes for adults AND children!

Are you a comedy nerd who watches old SNL skits and UCB videos on YouTube all day? A young professional trying to meet more people in the area but not sure that a kickball league is the right fit? A parent looking for creative outlets for their children? ALL THREE?

Push Comedy is the place for you. All of our classes are taught in a non-judgmental environment where the students build confidence, make friends, and most importantly - have fun!

Got questions? We (usually) have answers - feel free to email marketing@pushcomedytheater.com any of your questions, comments, concerns, or the gnawing thoughts that keep you up at night.

This class voucher is good for any (1) class offered at Push Comedy Theater in Norfolk, VA through July 31, 2019. (You've got 6 months to pick a class to take!)

Give the gift of laughter | Give the gift of community | Give the gift of Push

title: Stories With Santa
description:
Santa Claus is coming to the Push Comedy Theater!

Come visit with Santa and take part in interactive holiday stories. There will be stories, some improv and Santa.

Enjoy seasonal treats including cookies, hot cocoa, juice and coffee or tea for the adults.

Children will have a chance to chat with Santa and receive a goodie bag.

There is limited seating and reservations are recommended.

Parents, make sure to bring your cameras!



Stories with Santa

Saturday, December 15th

Sunday, December 16th

Friday, December 21st.

Saturday, December 22nd.

The show starts at 1pm.

Tickets are $5.

This show is fun for the whole family.

title: Harold Night
description:
It's Harold Night at the Push Comedy Theater!

So who the heck is Harold? More accurately the question should be... what the heck is a Harold?

The Harold is the big, bad grand daddy of all long form improv! It starts with an audience suggestion, then improvisers weave together scenes, characters and group games to create a seamless piece. It can be bizarre and magical, baffling and amazing... it definitely needs to be seen.

Harold Night

Friday, March 24th at 10:00pm

Tickets are $5

The Push Comedy Theater only has 99 seats, so we recommend you get your tickets in advance.

Free parking available at Slone Chiropractic (111 W Virginia Beach) just one block from the theater. There is also limited parking on the street.

title: The Made Up Movie
description:
Who needs Hollywood!

With a single audience suggestion, an entire movie is created right before your eyes.

Courageous heroes... dastardly villains... mind-blowing special effects... you'll see it all and more crammed into two 25 minutes sets of improv magic.

The Made Up Movie is a wild, crazy and energetic show, where you'll never know what's going to happen next.

Don't miss it.



The Made Up Movie

Friday, December 21st, 10pm

Tickets are $5

The Push Comedy Theater only has 99 seats, so we recommend you get your tickets in advance.

title: A Very Pushers Christmas
description:
Remember all those wonderful Christmas Specials you loved as a kid?

Remember the singing and the dancing and the loads of holiday cheer?

We sure do!

That's why we're proud to present our very own warped version of those timeless, holiday classics...A Very Pushers Christmas: An Inappropriate Comedy Show.

The Pushers are back with their 9th Annual Christmas Special!!!

Don't miss what's become one of Hampton Roads' greatest holiday traditions.

title: IMPROVAGEDDON: THE ULTIMATE IMPROV COMPETITION
description:
Prepare for Glory!!

Prepare for IMPROVAGEDDON: The Ultimate Improv Competition!!!

Who will raise the Hammer of Lowell in final victory? You'll have to come to this month's show to find out!

3 teams will be given just 15 minutes to perform any style of improv comedy they choose... all in a quest to be declared Improvageddon champ and raise the Hammer of Lowell in final victory.

This ain't your daddy's Improv cage match! If you think you've seen Improv competitions before then you ain't seen nothin yet!

Improvageddon combines Improv Comedy with stylistic elements of Professional Wrestling to create a truly unique, and most definitely over-the-top Improv contest.

Gimmicks will be displayed! Trash will be talked! Feats of comedic strength will be performed!

Let the final war for comedic supremacy begin!

IMPROVAGEDDON: The Ultimate Improv Competition!The last Saturday of every month

The show starts at 10:30pm

Tickets are $5

The Push Comedy Theater only has 99 seats, so we recommend you get your tickets in advance.

Free parking available at Slone Chiropractic (111 W Virginia Beach) just one block from the theater. There is also limited parking on the street, and in the lot directly in front of the theater.

title: The Pushie Awards Show
description:
Imagine the Oscars, the Emmys, the Tonys and Nickelodeon Kid's Choice Awards all rolled into one!

Well imagine no more... because the Push Comedy Theater is proud to announce The Third Annual Pushie Awards!!!

The Pushie Awards are our chance to honor some of the funniest performers, shows and moments of 2018.

Stay tuned for the full list of awards and nominees.

Like all award shows, this night will be full of pomp and circumstance, surprise guest stars, wonderful food and amazing performances.

The Pushie Awards will be held on Monday, December 31st from 5 to 9pm.

Don't miss on of the biggest comedy events of the year!!!

*********************************

The Pushie Awards Show

Monday, December 31st at 5pm

Tickets are $30 in advance, $40 the night of the show.

Free buffet will be provided

The Pushers have appeared at both The Charleston Comedy Festival and The North Carolina Comedy Arts Festival. In New York, they have performed at The People's Improv Theater, The Upright Citizen's Brigade and at The Kraine Theater in New York's East Village.

Here in Hampton Roads the group have performed most notably at The Jewish Mother, The NorVa and The Virginia Beach Funnybone.

full_description:
Get ready as we improvise your relationship.

It's the most fun you'll ever have on date night!

Two lucky couples will see their love unfold on stage through the interpretation of 2 of Hampton Roads' wackiest improvisers!

The couples will be selected at random and interviewed on stage in front of the audience. Using the information they learn, and their imagination, Brad and Alba will show the story of the couples' love.

For years, The Pushers have been getting to know diverse couples all across Hampton Roads with this signature piece. Normally this is a piece within a larger show. This time, Brad and Alba are out to explore as much as possible by bringing it to you as its own show!


Date Night: With Brad and Alba

Friday, January 4th at 8pm

Tickets are $10

---

title: Monocle: The Improvised One-Act Play!
description:
Monocle: The Improvised One-Act Play is a group of five good friends with over 50 years of stage & improv experience looking to make you laugh your ass off!

Here's how our show works:

We ask the audience for any song lyric (except "Hit me, baby, one more time." Ew.) With that one lyrical suggestion, we will improvise an entire one-act play!

We come up with big, funny characters and compelling storylines right in front of your eyes. It may be dramatic, maybe even a little tragic, but it's always funny (we are dipshits)!

Our show may look like we rehearsed it somehow, but we promise you there is no script. Just lots of laughs & lots of fun!

Comedy! Drama! Spectacle! Monocle!Monocle: The Improvised One-Act PlayFriday, January 4th at the Push Comedy TheaterThe show starts at 10 pm, tickets are $5

---

title: SKETCHMAGEDDON: The Ultimate Sketch Comedy Competition
description:
Last month, Sketch Me Outside defeated SHAT and ComicKazie.  Who will they face next...


--

Get ready for a sketch comedy show like no other!!!

SKETCHMAGEDDON takes three groups and forces them to compete in an all-out comedy deathmatch!

Each team will be given 15 minutes to dazzle you with their comedy prowess. It's Saturday Night Live meets Thunderdome!!!!

Unlike its improvised sister show IMPROVAGEDDON, SKETCHMAGEDDON features all written and rehearsed material.  Props, costumes, and special effects are all legal in SKETCHMAGEDDON.

This is a completely experimental show.  You never know what you are going to see.

SKETCHMAGEDDON: The Ultimate Sketch Comedy Competition

Saturday, January 9th at 10pm

Tickets are $5

------------

The Push Comedy Theater only has 99 seats, so we recommend you get your tickets in advance.

Free parking available at Slone Chiropractic (111 W Virginia Beach) just one block from the theater. There is also limited parking on the street.

title: The Unusual Suspects (formerly Who Dunnit)
description:
Who Dunnit: The Improvised Murder Mystery is now The Unusual Suspects... new name, same great show.

The hottest show in the history of the 757 is NOW A NATIONALLY TOURING SHOW!

The Unusual Suspects

Theres been a murder. Everyone is a suspect. The actors on stage. Even you.

Welcome to The Unusual Suspects, an improvised murder mystery comedy.

Throughout the night, the worlds greatest detective will interrogate a cast of unusual characters, from the wacky to the dastardly.

Youll find yourself face to face with our notorious investigator. Could he be Sherlock, Columbo, Jessica Fletcher? Not exactly. The catch is, no one ever knows which detective will show up.

No one is above suspicion, including you and your guests.

Join us at the hit show thats played to sold-out audiences for more than three years and counting. This isnt your standard dinner detective fare; get ready for a wild and funny night that everyone will be talking about the next day, your family, your friends, and maybe even your priest.

The Unusual Suspects is brought to you by the writers and producers of the off-Broadway and national hit: Cuff Me: The Fifty Shades of Grey Musical Parody.

The Unusual Suspects: An Improvised Murder Mystery Comedy

The second Saturday of every month at the Push Comedy Theater

The show starts at 8pm, tickets are $15

The Push Comedy Theater only has 99 seats, so we recommend you get your tickets in advance.

Free parking available at Slone Chiropractic (111 W Virginia Beach) just one block from the theater. There is also limited parking on the street.

title: ComicKaze presents SitComicKaze
description:
ComicKaze presents a sketch comedy show in the form of a fake (and SO not family friendly) sitcom.

What does that mean? Were still figuring it out!

Guaranteed to be a high-energy, laugh riot thatll make you want to binge watch all of our other shows!

ComicKaze: The comedy you deserve.

ComicKaze is the stray puppy of the Push Comedy Theater. Adorable and dirty. Playful and rambunctious. Likely to pee on your floor.

Featuring members of Short & Sweet, Sketch Me Like One of Your French Girls, and On the House, ComicKaze has been making sketch comedy videos for years and made their Push Comedy Theater debut with a winning set in Sketchmageddon.

Tickets are $10, show starts at 10pm.

title: The Bright Side: A Live Sketch & Improv Comedy Show!
description:
The Bright Side: A Live Sketch & Improv Comedy Show!

The Bright Side Sketch & Improv Comedy group brings their non-stop energy to the Push Comedy Theater stage for a live comedy show that you do not want to miss!

WHAT IS IT???

Sketch comedy: Ever seen SNL, Mad TV, Key & Peele? Crazy scenarios, weird props & costumes, bizarre characters! The only difference: You are in the live audience!

Improv comedy: Chicago-style long form improv. Don't worry, it's nothing like Chicago-style pizza. It's actually good! The Bright Side gets one word from the audience and uses it to make up an entire set of hilarious scenes on-the-spot!

WHO IS IT???

The Bright Side Sketch & Improv Comedy is a group of four friends formed in 2015 from the Push Comedy Theater in Norfolk, VA. Their particular brand of comedy is a celebration of the absurdity of the mundane world. Audiences at a Bright Side show can expect to see smart, polished comedy that reflects the groups bizarre, yet unrelentingly optimistic perspective. Look on The Bright Side!

WHEN & WHERE IS IT???

The Bright Side: A Live Sketch & Improv Comedy Show!!

Saturday, January 19th @ 8 p.m.

Push Comedy Theater, Tickets are $10

Come out to see and support one of Hampton Road's own sketch comedy groups at the intimate Push Comedy Theater in the heart of the new Norfolk Arts District!

title: Sketch Me Like One Of Your French Girls: Lost In Time, a Sketch Comedy Show
description:
After being voted the Best Breakout Group of 2018 & taking home the prize for Best Sketch of 2018 at the Push Comedy Theater, Sketch Me Like One Of Your French Girls is ecstatic to be bringing you their first full-length sketch comedy show! So clear your schedules, double check your time travel devices, and make sure to save this date, as Sketch Me is proud to present: Lost In Time.

Come into a world, where one comedy fan travels amongst the dimensions to save humanity from the tyranny of its bow tied, short pantsed overlord. Will he triumph on his just crusade? Or will his actions along the way trigger ripples of destruction throughout all of space and time. Anything and everything has, and has not occurred. One night only at Push Comedy Theater. Be there or be Lost In Time!

Sketch Me Like One Of Your French Girls is a sketch comedy group based out of Norfolk, VA. Their shows provide audiences with a blend of absurdity and the macabre, drawing humor out of a twisted perception of reality with the occasional subversive musical parody.

Tickets are $10 and are available to purchase beforehand or at the door (but its recommended to get them ahead of time, this show will sell out!)

-

Sketch Me Like One Of Your French Girls is a sketch comedy group based out of Norfolk, VA. Their shows provide audiences with a blend of absurdity and the macabre, drawing humor out of a twisted perception of reality with the occasional subversive musical parody.

Tickets are $10 and are available to purchase beforehand or at the door (but its recommended to get them ahead of time, this show will sell out!)

title: Date Night: An Improvised Story of Love
description:
Get ready as we improvise your relationship.

It's the most fun you'll ever have on date night!

Two lucky couples will see their love unfold on stage through the interpretation of 2 of Hampton Roads' wackiest improvisers!

The couples will be selected at random and interviewed on stage in front of the audience. Using the information they learn, and their imagination, Brad and Alba will show the story of the couples' love.

For years, The Pushers have been getting to know diverse couples all across Hampton Roads with this signature piece. Normally this is a piece within a larger show. This time, Brad and Alba are out to explore as much as possible by bringing it to you as its own show!



Date Night: An Improvised Story of Love

Friday, April 5th at 8pm

Tickets are $10

---

The Pushers are Virginia's premiere sketch and improv comedy group. For more than 11 years they have thrilled (and shocked) audiences with their wild antics both on and off stage. The group puts on a racy, high-octane, energetic show that is guaranteed to have audiences howling with laughter. In November of 2014, they opened their own theater, The Push Comedy Theater, located in the new Norfolk Arts District.

In 2013 The Pushers' Off-Broadway musical Cuff Me: The Unauthorized Fifty Shades of Grey Musical Parody debuted in New York City. It ran for over a year in both New York and Chicago. A third production is currently touring the country.

The Pushers have appeared at both The Charleston Comedy Festival and The North Carolina Comedy Arts Festival. In New York, they have performed at The People's Improv Theater, The Upright Citizen's Brigade and at The Kraine Theater in New York's East Village.

Here in Hampton Roads the group have performed most notably at The Jewish Mother, The NorVa and The Virginia Beach Funnybone.

title: Push Comedy Theater presents "That Sinking Feeling"
description:
THE STORY: After the Titanic strikes an iceberg, a cast of eclectic personalities must navigate life, death, and undeath when they discover their respective lifeboats are beset by madcap disasters in the form of inescapable fate, a murder mystery, and gothic horror. As the ship sinks, facts descend into fiction and reality descends into absurdity, but the truth is never far from the surface. All the while, the band plays on.

Admission: $10

title: The Unusual Suspects (formerly Who Dunnit)
description:
Who Dunnit: The Improvised Murder Mystery is now The Unusual Suspects... new name, same great show.

The hottest show in the history of the 757 is NOW A NATIONALLY TOURING SHOW!

The Unusual Suspects

Theres been a murder. Everyone is a suspect. The actors on stage. Even you.

Welcome to The Unusual Suspects, an improvised murder mystery comedy.

Throughout the night, the worlds greatest detective will interrogate a cast of unusual characters, from the wacky to the dastardly.

Youll find yourself face to face with our notorious investigator. Could he be Sherlock, Columbo, Jessica Fletcher? Not exactly. The catch is, no one ever knows which detective will show up.

No one is above suspicion, including you and your guests.

Join us at the hit show thats played to sold-out audiences for more than three years and counting. This isnt your standard dinner detective fare; get ready for a wild and funny night that everyone will be talking about the next day, your family, your friends, and maybe even your priest.

The Unusual Suspects is brought to you by the writers and producers of the off-Broadway and national hit: Cuff Me: The Fifty Shades of Grey Musical Parody.

The Unusual Suspects: An Improvised Murder Mystery Comedy

The second Saturday of every month at the Push Comedy Theater

The show starts at 8pm, tickets are $15



*

The Push Comedy Theater only has 99 seats, so we recommend you get your tickets in advance.

description:

title: Musical Harold Night
description:
The Harold is one of the oldest and most lauded forms of long-form improv.  Using a single audience suggestion as inspiration, each team creates a 25-minute run of scenes exploring a world of interconnected characters and ideas.

We're turning the Harold on it's ear, with music!!!

Don't miss... Musical Harold Night!!!  It's the Harold you know and love, now with music.  You'll see big opening and closing numbers, scenes and songs all made up on the spot.

Musical Harold Night comes to the Push Comedy Theater.

The first Thursday of the month at 8pm.

title: The Unusual Suspects (formerly Who Dunnit)
description:
Who Dunnit: The Improvised Murder Mystery is now The Unusual Suspects... new name, same great show.

The hottest show in the history of the 757 is NOW A NATIONALLY TOURING SHOW!

The Unusual Suspects

Theres been a murder. Everyone is a suspect. The actors on stage. Even you.

Welcome to The Unusual Suspects, an improvised murder mystery comedy.

Throughout the night, the worlds greatest detective will interrogate a cast of unusual characters, from the wacky to the dastardly.

Youll find yourself face to face with our notorious investigator. Could he be Sherlock, Columbo, Jessica Fletcher? Not exactly. The catch is, no one ever knows which detective will show up.

No one is above suspicion, including you and your guests.

Join us at the hit show thats played to sold-out audiences for more than three years and counting. This isnt your standard dinner detective fare; get ready for a wild and funny night that everyone will be talking about the next day, your family, your friends, and maybe even your priest.

The Unusual Suspects is brought to you by the writers and producers of the off-Broadway and national hit: Cuff Me: The Fifty Shades of Grey Musical Parody.

The Unusual Suspects: An Improvised Murder Mystery Comedy

The second Saturday of every month at the Push Comedy Theater

The show starts at 8pm, tickets are $15

The Push Comedy Theater only has 99 seats, so we recommend you get your tickets in advance.

---

The Push Comedy Theater is a 99 seat venue in the heart of Norfolk's brand new Arts District. Founded by local comedy group The Pushers, the Push Comedy Theater is dedicated to bringing you live comedy from the best local and national acts.

The Push Comedy Theater hosts live sketch, improv and stand-up comedy on Friday and Saturday nights. During the week classes are offered in stand-up, sketch and improv comedy as well as acting.

Whether you're a die-hard comedy lover or a casual fan... a seasoned performer or someone who's never stepped foot on stage... the Push Comedy Theater has something for you.

title: Character Workshop
description:
TIME TO GET YOUR CHARACTER ON!

There is already an event page, but change it if you want. Here's what i'm looking for:

Explore how to expand your characters in improvisation.

This two-day workshop, June 10th and 13th at The Push will focus on bringing your best characters and even characters you didn't know you had, to life on stage. We will explore crazy-man/straight man, being more in the moment with your characters, physicality, re-acting through character and new techniques to get you more in the world of your characters.

We will work on "if this is true, then what else is true," framing, and more importantly how to create characters on the spot that are memorable and hilarious. Bring a pen to this two day workshop. I assure you will have tons of ideas for new characters you want to play in both improvisation and sketch comedy... Super pumped for this workshop

This workshop will be limited to 20 people.

Character Workshop

Open to all improvisers

Tuition is 70$

title: Class Dismissed: The 301 Graduation Show
description:
Dust off those caps and gowns... It's Harold Graduation Time!!!

So who the heck is Harold? More accurately the question should be... what the heck is a Harold?

The Harold is perhaps the best know style of long form improv. It starts with an audience suggestion, then improvisers weave together scenes, characters and group games to create a seamless piece. It can be bizarre and magical, baffling and amazing... it definitely needs to be seen.

The Push Comedy Theater's 301 students take the Harold head on! Don't miss it

Class Dismissed: The 301 Graduation ShowWednesday, June 12th at 8:00pmTickets are $5

The Push Comedy Theater only has 99 seats, so we recommend you get your tickets in advance.

title: True Life: The Musical with Brant Powell
description:
True Life: The Musical is proud to have Brant Powell as our next guest.

Brant is an original member of The Pushers, Hampton Roads' premier sketch and improv comedy group.

Brant is the writer and director of That Sinking Feeling, a comedy about the Titanic that debuted this spring at TCC and the Push Comedy Theater.

Brant lived in New York where he tried to break into the comic book business.

Brant hates it when we talk about him like this.

Don't miss it as Brant talks about his days as a Pusher, living in New York, his crazy college parties, living life of a playwright and more.

True Life: The Musical

Thursday, June 13th at 8pm

Tickets are $5

True Life: The Musical is a monthly musical improv show that's the second Thursday of every month at the Push Comedy Theater at 8 pm.

Each month a guest tells a few stories from their life. Then the improvisers of True Life create a completely improvised musical inspired by the stories.  It's a magical night... don't miss it.

title: Spartacus Fartacus: An Improvised Journey Through History
description:
Let's get historical!

The pageant of history is a rich tapestry of both people and events... a journey from the then to the now.  History's importance cannot be discounted, for those who fail to acknowledge and learn from the mistakes of history shall be forever doomed to repeat them. Or some shit like that...

Spartacus Fartacus is Brad McMurran, Sean Devereux, and Ed Carden. 3 men seeking to bring history to life in the form of original improvised entertainment!

It starts with the audience suggestion of a historical event or figure, and then explodes into a great trek through the ages with only Brad, Ed, and Sean's knowledge of history (or lack thereof) as a guide.

It's like Bill and Ted's Excellent Adventure... but not as smart.

Spartacus Fartacus: An Improvised Journey Through History

Saturday, June 15th at 8pm

Tickets are $5

The Push Comedy Theater only has 99 seats, so we recommend you get your tickets in advance.

title: Always Be Comedy a Sketch Comedy Show
description:
ComicKaze presents the last sketch comedy show ever.  To be clear: we don't mean the last ComicKaze sketch comedy show, but THE LAST SKETCH COMEDY SHOW BY ANYONE EVER.

Were not saying the world is going to end. Were just saying, if you ever want to see a sketch comedy show before the oblivion takes us all, this is the one.

So say goodbye to your loved ones, finish up that bucket list, and then come to the funniest sketch comedy show youll see before were all consumed by fire!

ComicKaze: The comedy you deserve.

--------

ComicKaze is the stray puppy of the Push Comedy Theater. Adorable and dirty. Playful and rambunctious. Likely to pee on your floor.

Featuring members of Short & Sweet, Sketch Me Like One of Your French Girls, and On the House, ComicKaze has been making sketch comedy videos for years and made their Push Comedy Theater debut with a winning set in Sketchmageddon.

title: Game of Thrones: A Night of Improv and Fire
description:
Winter is coming to the Push Comedy Theater!!!

Are you sad Game of Thrones is over?  Disappointed about how Season 8 turned out?  Don't worry... we are here for you.

Nerdvana and the Push Comedy Theater are proud to present Game of Thrones: A Night of Improv and Fire.

It's a night of fully-improvised, comedy set in the world of Game of Thrones.  We'll have violence, betrayals and dragons!  All made up right in front of your eyes.  See how Season 8 should have turned out.

There will be a Game of Thrones trivia contest during intermission with some cool prizes.

Game of Thrones: A Night of Improv and Fire

Saturday, June 22nd at 8pm

Tickets are $10

**Like Game of Thrones, this show is not for the kids.

---

Nerdvana is a new show at the Push Comedy Show. It's a comedy show for nerds, by nerds. We lovingly poke fun at some of our favorite sci-fi and fantasy books, tv shows and movies. Star Wars, Game of Thrones, Doctor Who and more... nothing is safe. If you are a fan of all things nerd, you'll love this show.

title: Date Night: An Improvised Story of Love
description:
Get ready as we improvise your relationship.

It's the most fun you'll ever have on date night!

Two lucky couples will see their love unfold on stage through the interpretation of 2 of Hampton Roads' wackiest improvisers!

The couples will be selected at random and interviewed on stage in front of the audience. Using the information they learn, and their imagination, Brad and Alba will show the story of the couples' love.

For years, The Pushers have been getting to know diverse couples all across Hampton Roads with this signature piece. Normally this is a piece within a larger show. This time, Brad and Alba are out to explore as much as possible by bringing it to you as its own show!



Date Night: An Improvised Story of Love

Friday, July 5th at 8pm

Tickets are $10

---

The Pushers are Virginia's premiere sketch and improv comedy group. For more than 11 years they have thrilled (and shocked) audiences with their wild antics both on and off stage. The group puts on a racy, high-octane, energetic show that is guaranteed to have audiences howling with laughter. In November of 2014, they opened their own theater, The Push Comedy Theater, located in the new Norfolk Arts District.

In 2013 The Pushers' Off-Broadway musical Cuff Me: The Unauthorized Fifty Shades of Grey Musical Parody debuted in New York City. It ran for over a year in both New York and Chicago. A third production is currently touring the country.

The Pushers have appeared at both The Charleston Comedy Festival and The North Carolina Comedy Arts Festival. In New York, they have performed at The People's Improv Theater, The Upright Citizen's Brigade and at The Kraine Theater in New York's East Village.

Here in Hampton Roads the group have performed most notably at The Jewish Mother, The NorVa and The Virginia Beach Funnybone.

---

title: Tales from the Campfire: The Improvised Ghost Story
description:
I ain't afraid of no ghost!

title: True Life: The Musical with Jose Roman
description:
True Life: The Musical is proud to have Jose Roman as our next guest!

Each month a guest tells a few stories from their life. Then the improvisers of True Life create a completely improvised musical inspired by the stories.  It's a magical night... don't miss it.

Jose Roman is a writer, comic, and local producer that served 22 years in the Navy.  He currently works as a veteran advocate and outreach coordinator with the non-profit ASAP (the Armed Services Arts Partnership) that provides free art workshops in the HR and DC area in comedy, improv, acting, and creative writing to veterans and military families in the community.

True Life: The Musical is a monthly musical improv show that's the second Thursday of every month at the Push Comedy Theater at 8 pm. True Life: The MusicalThursday, July 11th at 8PMTickets are $5

title: The Unusual Suspects: An Improvised Murder Mystery
description:
Who Dunnit: The Improvised Murder Mystery is now The Unusual Suspects... new name, same great show.

The hottest show in the history of the 757 is NOW A NATIONALLY TOURING SHOW!

The Unusual Suspects

Theres been a murder. Everyone is a suspect. The actors on stage. Even you.

Welcome to The Unusual Suspects, an improvised murder mystery comedy.

Throughout the night, the worlds greatest detective will interrogate a cast of unusual characters, from the wacky to the dastardly.

Youll find yourself face to face with our notorious investigator. Could he be Sherlock, Columbo, Jessica Fletcher? Not exactly. The catch is, no one ever knows which detective will show up.

No one is above suspicion, including you and your guests.

Join us at the hit show thats played to sold-out audiences for more than three years and counting. This isnt your standard dinner detective fare; get ready for a wild and funny night that everyone will be talking about the next day, your family, your friends, and maybe even your priest.

The Unusual Suspects is brought to you by the writers and producers of the off-Broadway and national hit: Cuff Me: The Fifty Shades of Grey Musical Parody.

The Unusual Suspects: An Improvised Murder Mystery Comedy

The second Saturday of every month at the Push Comedy Theater

The show starts at 8pm, tickets are $15

The Push Comedy Theater only has 99 seats, so we recommend you get your tickets in advance.

title: The Bright Side: A Live Sketch & Improv Comedy Show!
description: The Bright Side: A Live Sketch & Improv Comedy Show!Comedy dies in darkness.The Bright Side Sketch & Improv Comedy group brings their non-stop energy to the Push Comedy Theater stage for a live comedy show that you do not want to miss! Featuring special comedy guests: The Dumpster Dudes!WHAT IS IT???Sketch comedy: Ever seen SNL, Mad TV, Key & Peele? Crazy scenarios, weird props & costumes, bizarre characters! The only difference: You are in the live audience!Improv comedy: Chicago-style long form improv. Don't worry, it's nothing like Chicago-style pizza. It's actually good! The Bright Side gets one word from the audience and uses it to make up an entire set of hilarious scenes on-the-spot!WHO IS IT???The Bright Side Sketch & Improv Comedy is a group of four friends - Matt Cole, Brian Garraty, Andrea Bourguignon, and Drew Richard - formed in 2015 from the Push Comedy Theater in Norfolk, VA. Their particular brand of comedy is a celebration of the absurdity of the mundane world. Audiences at a Bright Side show can expect to see smart, polished comedy that reflects the groups bizarre, unrelentingly optimistic perspective. Look on The Bright Side!Guests:The Dumpster Dudes Sketch ComedyWHEN & WHERE IS IT???The Bright Side: A Live Sketch & Improv Comedy Show!!Sunday, July 14th @ 7 p.m.Push Comedy TheaterTickets $10 at door or online:Come out to see and support one of Hampton Road's own sketch comedy groups at the intimate Push Comedy Theater in the heart of the new Norfolk Arts District!
full_description:
The Bright Side: A Live Sketch & Improv Comedy Show!
Comedy dies in darkness.

The Bright Side Sketch & Improv Comedy group brings their non-stop energy to the Push Comedy Theater stage for a live comedy show that you do not want to miss! Featuring special comedy guests: The Dumpster Dudes!

WHAT IS IT???

Sketch comedy: Ever seen SNL, Mad TV, Key & Peele? Crazy scenarios, weird props & costumes, bizarre characters! The only difference: You are in the live audience!

Improv comedy: Chicago-style long form improv. Don't worry, it's nothing like Chicago-style pizza. It's actually good! The Bright Side gets one word from the audience and uses it to make up an entire set of hilarious scenes on-the-spot!

WHO IS IT???

The Bright Side Sketch & Improv Comedy is a group of four friends - Matt Cole, Brian Garraty, Andrea Bourguignon, and Drew Richard - formed in 2015 from the Push Comedy Theater in Norfolk, VA. Their particular brand of comedy is a celebration of the absurdity of the mundane world. Audiences at a Bright Side show can expect to see smart, polished comedy that reflects the groups bizarre, unrelentingly optimistic perspective. Look on The Bright Side!

Guests:
The Dumpster Dudes Sketch Comedy

WHEN & WHERE IS IT???

The Bright Side: A Live Sketch & Improv Comedy Show!!
Sunday, July 14th @ 7 p.m.
Push Comedy Theater
Tickets $10 at door or online:


Come out to see and support one of Hampton Road's own sketch comedy groups at the intimate Push Comedy Theater in the heart of the new Norfolk Arts District!

title: The 5 Artists You Meet In Grad School (As told by Heidi Peelen)
description:
The 5 Artists You Meet In Grad School (As told by Heidi Peelen)

You could pay $11 for a decent meal and you would poop it out later and your $11 will be gone forever. BUT you could pay $11, change a life just by meeting some artsy people and not resent your poop.

If you went to Art Grad School you met these people.

If you didnt go to Art Grad school but you shared a campus with them, you met these people.

If youve ever seen art on a coffee shop wall or a poster about their upcoming art show on a coffee shop wall or ever just walked into a coffee shop with a coffee shop wall youve met these people in one way or another.

You dont have to be an artist to meet artists. Youve met them already. You can meet them all over again from the safety of an audience seat (and somewhere other than a coffee shop).

This one-woman show will isolate and re-introduce those 5 artists that you met (or didnt meet) (or havent met yet), poke fun at itself and at the artists portrayed in each category of the contemporary artist.

Disclaimer: the artist working today and not necessarily just contemporary art (as in the movement) because who has ever actually MET contemporary art or a movement in a coffee shop?

Despite these 5 artists best efforts to be the unique, non-conforming individualist, what unites them is that everybody is really unique in their own artsy way. This one-woman show will let you see inside their uniqueness. (and maybe into yours)

(Art Grad School Graduate Disclaimer about being the unique, non-confirming individualist: in grad school its very rare that anyone actually wants to sit down with you in your studio, listen to you drone on about your craft and why this piece is working or that piece isnt working while sipping overpriced coffee from a bodega. Its even more rare that they occasionally mumble thought-provoking questions in the abstract under their breath while you stammer and stumble about, grabbing sketches of this or that and shuffling through drawings while being fueled by anxiety and a need for a nugget of feedback on who you are and what your work means.)

Sorry, but nobody does that anymore. But we Artists try anyway. Out here grinding, y'all.

<Value Add Statement added for effect and also a Call to Action>

If you pay $11 for this performance, you will come away with empathy for the actress as she continually embarrasses herself. This show will make you feel better about your life, maybe forever.

Whether youre a 9 to 5er in a secure job with paid over time and benefits or a post art grad school person, or a self-educated artist or just a creative in general, if you are a really successful lawyer or business owner- it doesn't matter what you do. This show will make everyone appreciate parts of themselves and their lives.

Youre going to like the way you feel, I guarantee it. (but also no refunds, so)

The 5 Artists You Meet In Grad School (As told by Heidi Peelen)

Friday, July 19th, 8pm

Tickets $11

title: Class Dismissed: 201 Grad Show
description:
Dust off those caps and gowns... because it's graduation time at the Push.

Check out the Push Comedy Theater's Improv 201 class as they show off their comedy chops.

Watch as these brave 201 souls dive head first into the wonderful world of The Harold. So who the heck is Harold? More accurately the question should be... what the heck is a Harold?

The Harold is perhaps the best know style of long form improv. It starts with an audience suggestion, then improvisers weave together scenes, characters and group games to create a seamless piece. It can be bizarre and magical, baffling and amazing... it definitely needs to be seen.

Class Dismissed: The Improv 201 Graduation Show

Tuesday July 23rd at 8pm

Tickets are $5

The Push Comedy Theater only has 99 seats, so we recommend you get your tickets in advance.

description:
Get ready for a summer full of comedy!!!

The last Thursday of the month we'll be pairing a Push Comedy Theater favorite with something brand new.  New groups, new performers, new styles of improv... all for just $5.  It's a night of tried and true vets and young comedy upstarts.  Don't miss it.

This month:

The Improv Riot: The Short Form Improv Show

Get ready for short form (Whose Line is it Anyway?) improv at the Push Comedy Theater.

You demanded it! So now it's here!!! Our very own short form improv show. All the fun of Whose Line is it Anyway... right here in Downtown Norfolk.

Left Swipe

Remember that weird first date you had? The one with the girl that was sexy and funny and turned you on in a way that made you question your manhood? The one that had so many red flags she could have been a socialist country? Yeah that one. Left Swipe is like her.

Left Swipe is made up of 4 young and super hot Hampton Roads gals who will make you laugh so hard youll wanna marry us without signing a prenup.

title: homeGROWN
description:
homeGROWN

by rebekah rickards

The self appointed DIY, macaroni necklace, KWEEN of comedy makes her PUSH COMEDY debut with an hour special of leather-car -seat- HOT sketches, engorged with music, DANCE, and XXLarger than life characters serving as the fluorescent jelly to this delicious, comedy-filled donut.

Dont slip, just slide, through PUSH COMEDY to see this dance-comedy extravaganza!



homeGROWN

Sunday, July 28 @ 7:00pm

Tickets: $10



Rebekah Rickards:

Virginia Beach native, Rebekah Rickards, has been a dance educator, choreographer, and comedic performing Artist for over a decade. Having studied, performed and choreographed work along the East Coast, predominately Philadelphia and New York, Rebekah proves to be a strong, collaborative voice with a passion for originality through innovation. She works full time as a freelance performer, producer, and choreographer, most recently touring her solo comedy show; HOMESHOW! Fail to Win, a Losers Journey. Her artistic voice continues to find connections between her various expressions of interests including; dance, comedy, film, storytelling, and shared human experience.
full_description:
homeGROWN

by rebekah rickards

The self appointed DIY, macaroni necklace, KWEEN of comedy makes her PUSH COMEDY debut with an hour special of leather-car -seat- HOT sketches, engorged with music, DANCE, and XXLarger than life characters serving as the fluorescent jelly to this delicious, comedy-filled donut.

Dont slip, just slide, through PUSH COMEDY to see this dance-comedy extravaganza!


homeGROWN

Sunday, July 28 @ 7:00pm

Tickets: $10


Rebekah Rickards:

Virginia Beach native, Rebekah Rickards, has been a dance educator, choreographer, and comedic performing Artist for over a decade. Having studied, performed and choreographed work along the East Coast, predominately Philadelphia and New York, Rebekah proves to be a strong, collaborative voice with a passion for originality through innovation. She works full time as a freelance performer, producer, and choreographer, most recently touring her solo comedy show; HOMESHOW! Fail to Win, a Losers Journey. Her artistic voice continues to find connections between her various expressions of interests including; dance, comedy, film, storytelling, and shared human experience.

title: Class Dismissed: 201 Grad Show
description:
Dust off those caps and gowns... because it's graduation time at the Push.

Check out the Push Comedy Theater's Improv 201 class as they show off their comedy chops.

Watch as these brave 201 souls dive head first into the wonderful world of The Harold. So who the heck is Harold? More accurately the question should be... what the heck is a Harold?

The Harold is perhaps the best know style of long form improv. It starts with an audience suggestion, then improvisers weave together scenes, characters and group games to create a seamless piece. It can be bizarre and magical, baffling and amazing... it definitely needs to be seen.

Class Dismissed: The Improv 201 Graduation Show

Tuesday Steptember 17th at 8pm

Tickets are $5

The Push Comedy Theater only has 99 seats, so we recommend you get your tickets in advance.

title: Date Night: An Improvised Story of Love
description:
Get ready as we improvise your relationship.

It's the most fun you'll ever have on date night!

Two lucky couples will see their love unfold on stage through the interpretation of 2 of Hampton Roads' wackiest improvisers!

The couples will be selected at random and interviewed on stage in front of the audience. Using the information they learn, and their imagination, Brad and Alba will show the story of the couples' love.

For years, The Pushers have been getting to know diverse couples all across Hampton Roads with this signature piece. Normally this is a piece within a larger show. This time, Brad and Alba are out to explore as much as possible by bringing it to you as its own show!



Date Night: An Improvised Story of Love

First Friday of the Month at 8:00 PM

Tickets are $10

---

The Pushers are Virginia's premiere sketch and improv comedy group. For more than 11 years they have thrilled (and shocked) audiences with their wild antics both on and off stage. The group puts on a racy, high-octane, energetic show that is guaranteed to have audiences howling with laughter. In November of 2014, they opened their own theater, The Push Comedy Theater, located in the new Norfolk Arts District.

In 2013 The Pushers' Off-Broadway musical Cuff Me: The Unauthorized Fifty Shades of Grey Musical Parody debuted in New York City. It ran for over a year in both New York and Chicago. A third production is currently touring the country.

The Pushers have appeared at both The Charleston Comedy Festival and The North Carolina Comedy Arts Festival. In New York, they have performed at The People's Improv Theater, The Upright Citizen's Brigade and at The Kraine Theater in New York's East Village.

Here in Hampton Roads the group have performed most notably at The Jewish Mother, The NorVa and The Virginia Beach Funnybone.

---

title: The Unusual Suspects: An Improvised Murder Mystery
description:
Who Dunnit: The Improvised Murder Mystery is now The Unusual Suspects... new name, same great show.

The hottest show in the history of the 757 is NOW A NATIONALLY TOURING SHOW!

The Unusual Suspects

Theres been a murder. Everyone is a suspect. The actors on stage. Even you.

Welcome to The Unusual Suspects, an improvised murder mystery comedy.

Throughout the night, the worlds greatest detective will interrogate a cast of unusual characters, from the wacky to the dastardly.

Youll find yourself face to face with our notorious investigator. Could he be Sherlock, Columbo, Jessica Fletcher? Not exactly. The catch is, no one ever knows which detective will show up.

No one is above suspicion, including you and your guests.

Join us at the hit show thats played to sold-out audiences for more than three years and counting. This isnt your standard dinner detective fare; get ready for a wild and funny night that everyone will be talking about the next day, your family, your friends, and maybe even your priest.

The Unusual Suspects is brought to you by the writers and producers of the off-Broadway and national hit: Cuff Me: The Fifty Shades of Grey Musical Parody.

The Unusual Suspects: An Improvised Murder Mystery Comedy

The second Saturday of every month at the Push Comedy Theater

The show starts at 8pm, tickets are $15

The Push Comedy Theater only has 99 seats, so we recommend you get your tickets in advance.

title: The Neon Festival at the Push (FREE SHOW!!!)
description:
The NEON Festival comes to the Push!!!

In honor of this amazing celebration, the Push will be hosting free improv shows all night long.

Starting at 5:30 we will have a free improv shows every half hour featuring The Pushers and some of the Push Comedy Theater's funniest improvisers.

The Neon Festival at the Push (FREE SHOW!!!)

Friday, October 18th.  Free shows every half hour starting at 5:30

____________________________________________________

The 5th Annual NEON Festival is coming back to NFK Thursday, October 17 and Friday, October 18, 2019!

Presented by Business Consortium for Arts Support and Old Dominion University, this free festival welcomes everyone to experience the NEON District through art exhibitions, local and national performances, mural tours and programming unique to Norfolk's first arts neighborhood.

For more information, visit http://neonnfk.com/festival/

The 2019 celebration includes:

* The Chrysler Museum of Art open late Thursday

* Third Thursday at the Chrysler Museum Glass Studio

* Opening Reception Thursday at d'Art Center

* The Plot Beer Garden and entertainment Friday evening

* Tidewater Community College glass blowing, art exhibition and beer garden at Glass Wheel Studio Friday evening

* 5 new murals unveiled

* NEON District Public Art Tours both nights

* Pop up art galleries in local businesses

* Live music and brews at Bearded Bird Brewing Co. Friday

* Community programming from The Governor's School for the Arts, Teens With a Purpose, Push Comedy Theater, Hurrah Players and many more!

Full schedule to be announced in September.

Interested in volunteering during the festival?

Register here for a shift Thursday or Friday evening:

https://downtownnorfolk.wufoo.com/forms/neon-festi...

title: The Push Comedy Theater Halloween Spooktacular!!!
description:
Halloween is almost here... and that means it's time for The Push Comedy Theater Halloween Spooktacular!!!

Hampton Roads' best Halloween tradition is back with a vengeance.



The Pushers have invited their friends for a freaky and frightening new show chock full of our trademarked racy and raucous humor. This is the show people are going to be talking about for a long time to come.



Don't miss The Pushers, ComicKaze Sketch Comedy, Dumpster Dudes, Sketch Me Like One of Your French Girls and more!!!



The Push Comedy Theater Halloween Spooktacular!!!

It has all the spooks, frights and carnage of a normal Pushers' show only it's all amped up to 11.



The Pushers Halloween Spooktacular

Saturday, October 19th at The Push Comedy Theater

The show starts at 10:30pm
full_description:
Halloween is almost here... and that means it's time for The Push Comedy Theater Halloween Spooktacular!!!

Hampton Roads' best Halloween tradition is back with a vengeance.


The Pushers have invited their friends for a freaky and frightening new show chock full of our trademarked racy and raucous humor. This is the show people are going to be talking about for a long time to come.


Don't miss The Pushers, ComicKaze Sketch Comedy, Dumpster Dudes, Sketch Me Like One of Your French Girls and more!!!


The Push Comedy Theater Halloween Spooktacular!!!

It has all the spooks, frights and carnage of a normal Pushers' show only it's all amped up to 11.


The Pushers Halloween Spooktacular

Saturday, October 19th at The Push Comedy Theater

title: IMPROVAGEDDON: THE ULTIMATE IMPROV COMPETITION
description:
Prepare for Glory!!

Prepare for IMPROVAGEDDON: The Ultimate Improv Competition!!!

Who will raise the Hammer of Lowell in final victory? You'll have to come to this month's show to find out!

3 teams will be given just 15 minutes to perform any style of improv comedy they choose... all in a quest to be declared Improvageddon champ and raise the Hammer of Lowell in final victory.

This ain't your daddy's Improv cage match! If you think you've seen Improv competitions before then you ain't seen nothin yet!

Improvageddon combines Improv Comedy with stylistic elements of Professional Wrestling to create a truly unique, and most definitely over-the-top Improv contest.

Gimmicks will be displayed! Trash will be talked! Feats of comedic strength will be performed!

Let the final war for comedic supremacy begin!

IMPROVAGEDDON: The Ultimate Improv Competition!The last Saturday of every month

The show starts at 10:00pm

Tickets are $5

The Push Comedy Theater only has 99 seats, so we recommend you get your tickets in advance.

title: Date Night: An Improvised Story of Love
description:
Get ready as we improvise your relationship.

It's the most fun you'll ever have on date night!

Two lucky couples will see their love unfold on stage through the interpretation of 2 of Hampton Roads' wackiest improvisers!

The couples will be selected at random and interviewed on stage in front of the audience. Using the information they learn, and their imagination, Brad and Alba will show the story of the couples' love.

For years, The Pushers have been getting to know diverse couples all across Hampton Roads with this signature piece. Normally this is a piece within a larger show. This time, Brad and Alba are out to explore as much as possible by bringing it to you as its own show!



Date Night: An Improvised Story of Love

First Friday of the Month at 8:00 PM

Tickets are $10

---

The Pushers are Virginia's premiere sketch and improv comedy group. For more than 11 years they have thrilled (and shocked) audiences with their wild antics both on and off stage. The group puts on a racy, high-octane, energetic show that is guaranteed to have audiences howling with laughter. In November of 2014, they opened their own theater, The Push Comedy Theater, located in the new Norfolk Arts District.

In 2013 The Pushers' Off-Broadway musical Cuff Me: The Unauthorized Fifty Shades of Grey Musical Parody debuted in New York City. It ran for over a year in both New York and Chicago. A third production is currently touring the country.

The Pushers have appeared at both The Charleston Comedy Festival and The North Carolina Comedy Arts Festival. In New York, they have performed at The People's Improv Theater, The Upright Citizen's Brigade and at The Kraine Theater in New York's East Village.

Here in Hampton Roads the group have performed most notably at The Jewish Mother, The NorVa and The Virginia Beach Funnybone.

---

Whether you're a die-hard comedy lover or a casual fan... a seasoned performer or someone who's never stepped foot on stage... the Push Comedy Theater has something for you.

title: The Unusual Suspects: An Improvised Murder Mystery
description:
Who Dunnit: The Improvised Murder Mystery is now The Unusual Suspects... new name, same great show.

The hottest show in the history of the 757 is NOW A NATIONALLY TOURING SHOW!

The Unusual Suspects

Theres been a murder. Everyone is a suspect. The actors on stage. Even you.

Welcome to The Unusual Suspects, an improvised murder mystery comedy.

Throughout the night, the worlds greatest detective will interrogate a cast of unusual characters, from the wacky to the dastardly.

Youll find yourself face to face with our notorious investigator. Could he be Sherlock, Columbo, Jessica Fletcher? Not exactly. The catch is, no one ever knows which detective will show up.

No one is above suspicion, including you and your guests.

Join us at the hit show thats played to sold-out audiences for more than three years and counting. This isnt your standard dinner detective fare; get ready for a wild and funny night that everyone will be talking about the next day, your family, your friends, and maybe even your priest.

The Unusual Suspects is brought to you by the writers and producers of the off-Broadway and national hit: Cuff Me: The Fifty Shades of Grey Musical Parody.

The Unusual Suspects: An Improvised Murder Mystery Comedy

The second Saturday of every month at the Push Comedy Theater

The show starts at 8pm, tickets are $15

The Push Comedy Theater only has 99 seats, so we recommend you get your tickets in advance.

title: Good Talk: The Brad McMurran Show
description:
Good Talk : I Never Gave Up Hope

The wildly successful one man show by The Push Comedy Theaters own Brad McMurran is back and more in your face than ever. This show will use McMurrans favorite Facebook posts from the last year with a comedic focus on his departed best friend. Good Talk: I Never Gave Up Hope will be as unpredictable as the comedian that performs in it.

------

Get ready for a night of comedy from the Pushers' own Brad McMurran.

From the journals and Facebook posts of Brad McMurran, comes Brad's crazy experiences with drugs and alcohol. And there have been many. From peace pipes with Native Americans to waking up in the gutter on Colley Avenue... don't miss this alcohol and drug-filled ride.

Good Talk: The Brad McMurran Show

Fridayy, November 15th at 8pm

Tickets are $15

Good Talk is a one-man show starring Brad McMurran and focusing on McMurran's wildly popular Facebook posts.

Each month, Good Talk looks at the life and experiences of a sketch and improv comedian. Through storytelling, improv and mixed media, Brad will bring his Good Talk Facebook posts to life.

You'll see is struggles with bill collectors, relationships, alcohol, parents, opening a theater and just trying to act like an adult.

The show is going to be an unpredictable, wild and borderline-insane ride... just like Brad's life.

title: Spartacus Fartacus: An Improvised Journey Through History
description:
Let's get historical!

The pageant of history is a rich tapestry of both people and events... a journey from the then to the now.  History's importance cannot be discounted, for those who fail to acknowledge and learn from the mistakes of history shall be forever doomed to repeat them. Or some shit like that...

Spartacus Fartacus is Brad McMurran, Sean Devereux, and Ed Carden. 3 men seeking to bring history to life in the form of original improvised entertainment!

It starts with the audience suggestion of a historical event or figure, and then explodes into a great trek through the ages with only Brad, Ed, and Sean's knowledge of history (or lack thereof) as a guide.

It's like Bill and Ted's Excellent Adventure... but not as smart.

***This will be a very special Brad's Birthday Spartacus!!! Don't miss it.***





Spartacus Fartacus: An Improvised Journey Through History

Saturday. November 16th at 8pm

Tickets are $5

The Push Comedy Theater only has 99 seats, so we recommend you get your tickets in advance.

title: ComicKaze presents There Is No Santa Claus (In This Show)
description:
Mid-November is far too early for a Christmas-themed Sketch Comedy show, so ComicKaze Sketch Comedy feat. The Dumpster Dudes assures you that THERE IS NO SANTA CLAUS... in this show. If you come to see this show, you will see hilarious, non-festive comedy scenes, and what wont you see? Santa Claus, because SANTA DOESNT EXIST... in this show. Just to be clear, Santa Claus is an absolute fabrication that no fool, no matter how young, should ever believe in... in this show. COMEDY!

ComicKaze presents There Is No Santa Claus (In This Show) feat. The Dumpster Dudes
November 16th | 10PM | $10
------------
ComicKaze is the stray puppy of the Push Comedy Theater. Adorable and dirty. Playful and rambunctious. Likely to pee on your floor.
Featuring Kasey Kennedy, Austin Johnson, Alex Weller, Patrick C. Taylor, Trip Rumble, and special guests Yasmeen Freightman & Erika Guess, ComicKaze has been making sketch comedy videos for years and made their Push Comedy Theater debut with a winning set in Sketchmageddon, as well as performing at Philly Sketch Fest and the Virginia Beach Funny Bone.
------------
Dumpster Dudes
The semi-undefeated Sketchmageddon champions, Dumpster Dudes, bring the funny. Theyve discovered that the key to comedy is jokes, and lots of them! They perform sketches that are both funny and on stage. Youll love how dedicated they are to making humorous quips and witticisms for you, live! Youll think they made it all up, but they didnt, it was written.
Dumpster Dudes. Live on stage sketch comedy.
--------------

title: Harold Night
description:
It's Harold Night at the Push Comedy Theater!

So who the heck is Harold? More accurately the question should be... what the heck is a Harold?

title: Date Night: An Improvised Story of Love
description:
Get ready as we improvise your relationship.

It's the most fun you'll ever have on date night!

Two lucky couples will see their love unfold on stage through the interpretation of 2 of Hampton Roads' wackiest improvisers!

The couples will be selected at random and interviewed on stage in front of the audience. Using the information they learn, and their imagination, Brad and Alba will show the story of the couples' love.

For years, The Pushers have been getting to know diverse couples all across Hampton Roads with this signature piece. Normally this is a piece within a larger show. This time, Brad and Alba are out to explore as much as possible by bringing it to you as its own show!



Date Night: An Improvised Story of Love

First Friday of the Month at 8:00 PM

Tickets are $10

---

The Pushers are Virginia's premiere sketch and improv comedy group. For more than 11 years they have thrilled (and shocked) audiences with their wild antics both on and off stage. The group puts on a racy, high-octane, energetic show that is guaranteed to have audiences howling with laughter. In November of 2014, they opened their own theater, The Push Comedy Theater, located in the new Norfolk Arts District.

In 2013 The Pushers' Off-Broadway musical Cuff Me: The Unauthorized Fifty Shades of Grey Musical Parody debuted in New York City. It ran for over a year in both New York and Chicago. A third production is currently touring the country.

The Pushers have appeared at both The Charleston Comedy Festival and The North Carolina Comedy Arts Festival. In New York, they have performed at The People's Improv Theater, The Upright Citizen's Brigade and at The Kraine Theater in New York's East Village.

Here in Hampton Roads the group have performed most notably at The Jewish Mother, The NorVa and The Virginia Beach Funnybone.

---

title: The Unusual Suspects: An Improvised Murder Mystery
description:
Who Dunnit: The Improvised Murder Mystery is now The Unusual Suspects... new name, same great show.

The hottest show in the history of the 757 is NOW A NATIONALLY TOURING SHOW!



The Unusual Suspects

Theres been a murder. Everyone is a suspect. The actors on stage. Even you.

Welcome to The Unusual Suspects, an improvised murder mystery comedy.

Throughout the night, the worlds greatest detective will interrogate a cast of unusual characters, from the wacky to the dastardly.

Youll find yourself face to face with our notorious investigator. Could he be Sherlock, Columbo, Jessica Fletcher? Not exactly. The catch is, no one ever knows which detective will show up.

No one is above suspicion, including you and your guests.

Join us at the hit show thats played to sold-out audiences for more than three years and counting. This isnt your standard dinner detective fare; get ready for a wild and funny night that everyone will be talking about the next day, your family, your friends, and maybe even your priest.

The Unusual Suspects is brought to you by the writers and producers of the off-Broadway and national hit: Cuff Me: The Fifty Shades of Grey Musical Parody.





The Unusual Suspects: An Improvised Murder Mystery Comedy

The second Saturday of every month at the Push Comedy Theater



The show starts at 8pm, tickets are $15



The Push Comedy Theater only has 99 seats, so we recommend you get your tickets in advance.

title: Push Comedy Class Sale
description:
Give the gift of Push Comedy this holiday season!

In addition to our weekly shows we also teach classes for adults AND children!

Are you a comedy nerd who watches old SNL skits and UCB videos on YouTube all day? A young professional trying to meet more people in the area but not sure that a kickball league is the right fit? A parent looking for creative outlets for their children? ALL THREE?

Push Comedy is the place for you. All of our classes are taught in a non-judgmental environment where the students build confidence, make friends, and most importantly - have fun!



Adult classes are 6 weeks and cost $185 ($25 off our regular price) and our teen and pre-teen courses are 6 weeks for $155 (also $25 off)!!! 



Got questions? We (usually) have answers - feel free to email marketing@pushcomedytheater.com any of your questions, comments, concerns, or the gnawing thoughts that keep you up at night.

This class voucher is good for any (1) class offered at Push Comedy Theater in Norfolk, VA through July 31, 2019. (You've got 6 months to pick a class to take!)

Give the gift of laughter | Give the gift of community | Give the gift of Push

title: Monocle: The Improvised One-Act Play!
description:
Monocle: The Improvised One-Act Play is a group of five good friends with over 50 years of stage & improv experience looking to make you laugh your ass off!

Here's how our show works:

We ask the audience for any song lyric (except "Hit me, baby, one more time." Ew.) With that one lyrical suggestion, we will improvise an entire one-act play!

We come up with big, funny characters and compelling storylines right in front of your eyes. It may be dramatic, maybe even a little tragic, but it's always funny (we are dipshits)!

Our show may look like we rehearsed it somehow, but we promise you there is no script. Just lots of laughs & lots of fun!

Comedy! Drama! Spectacle! Monocle!Monocle: The Improvised One-Act PlayFirst Friday of the month at the Push Comedy TheaterThe show starts at 10 pm, tickets are $5

title: The Unusual Suspects: An Improvised Murder Mystery
description:
Who Dunnit: The Improvised Murder Mystery is now The Unusual Suspects... new name, same great show.

The hottest show in the history of the 757 is NOW A NATIONALLY TOURING SHOW!

The Unusual Suspects

Theres been a murder. Everyone is a suspect. The actors on stage. Even you.

Welcome to The Unusual Suspects, an improvised murder mystery comedy.

Throughout the night, the worlds greatest detective will interrogate a cast of unusual characters, from the wacky to the dastardly.

Youll find yourself face to face with our notorious investigator. Could he be Sherlock, Columbo, Jessica Fletcher? Not exactly. The catch is, no one ever knows which detective will show up.

No one is above suspicion, including you and your guests.

Join us at the hit show thats played to sold-out audiences for more than three years and counting. This isnt your standard dinner detective fare; get ready for a wild and funny night that everyone will be talking about the next day, your family, your friends, and maybe even your priest.

The Unusual Suspects is brought to you by the writers and producers of the off-Broadway and national hit: Cuff Me: The Fifty Shades of Grey Musical Parody.

The Unusual Suspects: An Improvised Murder Mystery Comedy

The second Saturday of every month at the Push Comedy Theater

The show starts at 8pm, tickets are $15

The Push Comedy Theater only has 99 seats, so we recommend you get your tickets in advance.

title: ASSSSSCAT Jam
description:
Let's get wild! Let's get crazy! It's ASSSSSCAT time baby!
Yes... you read that right. ASSSSSCAT. You may be asking yourself... what the heck is an ASSSSSCAT?!? And it would be a valid question. Just know that it's a cazy and fun night of improv.
With just a single word suggestion, watch as some of The Push Theater's most celebrated improvisers create spontaneous hilarity before your very eyes! Get ready for a journey into the irreverent. Get ready for ASSSSSCAT!

title: IMPROV SAMPLER PLATTER
description:
IMPROV SAMPLER PLATTER

Variety is the spice of life! Improv comedy comes in many forms. Why limit yourself to just one style, when you can have more, am I right? If youve ever had this thought occur to you like a lightning bolt out of the great blue yonder, than IMPROV SAMPLER PLATTER is the show for you!

Not one, not two, but THREE different types of improv comedy will be performed for you and the rest of the assembled crowd, all in the same show!

Prepare to experience multiple flavors of this hilarious performance form! The Improv Sampler Platter is here thrill!


IMPROV SAMPLER PLATTER
Saturday, January 18th at 8pm
Tickets are $5

title: Class Dismissed: The Improv 301 Graduation Show
description: It's Harold Time!!!  So who the heck is Harold? More accurately the question should be... what the heck is a Harold?   The Harold is perhaps the best know style of long form improv. It  starts with an audience suggestion, then improvisers weave together  scenes, characters and group games to create a seamless piece. It can be  bizarre and magical, baffling and amazing... it definitely needs to be  seen.  The Push Comedy Theater's 301 students take the Harold head on! Don't miss it.  Class Dismissed: The Improv 301 Graduation ShowMonday, January 20th at 8pm Tickets are $5   The Push Comedy Theater only has 99 seats, so we recommend you get your tickets in advance.
full_description:
It's Harold Time!!!

So who the heck is Harold? More accurately the question should be... what the heck is a Harold?

The Harold is perhaps the best know style of long form improv. It starts with an audience suggestion, then improvisers weave together scenes, characters and group games to create a seamless piece. It can be bizarre and magical, baffling and amazing... it definitely needs to be seen.

The Push Comedy Theater's 301 students take the Harold head on! Don't miss it.

title: Couples Therapy
description:
You think your relationship has problems?!?

In Couples Therapy you'll meet a couple on the rocks... be it newlyweds on a honeymoon from hell or an elderly couple at the end of their rope.Based on an audience suggestion, they take you on a roller coaster ride of emotions as they whisk you the trials and tribulations of couple they create right before your eyes.

Oh yeah, and they do it all in a single, 25 minute long improvised scene.

Two Improvisers... One Scene!!!

Couples Therapy... is sometimes hilarious, sometimes poignant, always magical.

Couples TherapyFriday, January 24th at 8PMTickets are $5

The Push Comedy Theater only has 99 seats, so we recommend you get your tickets in advance.

title: The Improv Riot: The Short Form Improv Show
description:
Get ready for short form (Whose Line is it Anyway?) improv at the Push Comedy Theater.

You demanded it! So now it's here!!! Our very own short form improv show. All the fun of Whose Line is it Anyway... right here in Norfolk.

The Improv Riot: The Short Form Improv Show

The Last Friday of every month at 8pm

Tickets are $5

The Push Comedy Theater only has 99 seats, so we recommend you get your tickets in advance.

---

The Pushers are Virginia's premiere sketch and improv comedy group. For nearly ten years they have thrilled (and shocked) audiences with their wild antics both on and off stage. The group puts on a racy, high-octane, energetic show that is guaranteed to have audiences howling with laughter. In November of 2014, they opened The Push Comedy Theater, located in the Norfolk Arts District.

In 2013 The Pushers' Off-Broadway musical Cuff Me: The Unauthorized Fifty Shades of Grey Musical Parody debuted in New York City. It ran for over a year in both New York and Chicago. A third production is currently touring the country.

The Pushers have appeared at both The Charleston Comedy Festival and The North Carolina Comedy Arts Festival. In New York, they have performed at The People's Improv Theater, The Upright Citizen's Brigade and at The Kraine Theater in New York's East Village.

Here in Hampton Roads the group have performed most notably at The Jewish Mother, The NorVa and The Virginia Beach Funnybone.

Whether you're a die-hard comedy lover or a casual fan... a seasoned performer or someone who's never stepped foot on stage... the Push Comedy Theater has something for you.

title: Date Night: An Improvised Story of Love
description:
Get ready as we improvise your relationship.

It's the most fun you'll ever have on date night!

Two lucky couples will see their love unfold on stage through the interpretation of 2 of Hampton Roads' wackiest improvisers!

The couples will be selected at random and interviewed on stage in front of the audience. Using the information they learn, and their imagination, Brad and Alba will show the story of the couples' love.

For years, The Pushers have been getting to know diverse couples all across Hampton Roads with this signature piece. Normally this is a piece within a larger show. This time, Brad and Alba are out to explore as much as possible by bringing it to you as its own show!



Date Night: An Improvised Story of Love

First Friday of the Month at 8:00 PM

Tickets are $10

Join us at the hit show thats played to sold-out audiences for more than three years and counting. This isnt your standard dinner detective fare; get ready for a wild and funny night that everyone will be talking about the next day, your family, your friends, and maybe even your priest.

The Unusual Suspects is brought to you by the writers and producers of the off-Broadway and national hit: Cuff Me: The Fifty Shades of Grey Musical Parody.

The Unusual Suspects: An Improvised Murder Mystery Comedy

The second Saturday of every month at the Push Comedy Theater

The show starts at 8pm, tickets are $15

The Push Comedy Theater only has 99 seats, so we recommend you get your tickets in advance.

title: Spartacus Fartacus: An Improvised Journey Through History
description:
Let's get historical!

The pageant of history is a rich tapestry of both people and events... a journey from the then to the now.  History's importance cannot be discounted, for those who fail to acknowledge and learn from the mistakes of history shall be forever doomed to repeat them. Or some shit like that...

Spartacus Fartacus is Brad McMurran, Sean Devereux, and Ed Carden. 3 men seeking to bring history to life in the form of original improvised entertainment!

It starts with the audience suggestion of a historical event or figure, and then explodes into a great trek through the ages with only Brad, Ed, and Sean's knowledge of history (or lack thereof) as a guide.

It's like Bill and Ted's Excellent Adventure... but not as smart.

Spartacus Fartacus: An Improvised Journey Through History

Friday, February 21st at 8pm

Tickets are $8.  Every tickets comes with a hot dog.

The Push Comedy Theater only has 99 seats, so we recommend you get your tickets in advance.

title: Face for Radio: A Live Radio Play
description:
Faces for Radio is a comedic live radio play coming out of the Push Comedy Theater in Norfolk, VA. The show is a modern and hilarious take on Radio Shows from the 30s and 40s; think Modern Family meets the George Burns and Gracie Allen Show.



The show features the character work and vocal talents of Scot Rose and Hilary Stallings and the sound effect stylings of Lindsay Horne. With originally written wacky characters, slap-stick sound effects and old-school advertisements; Faces for Radio is sure to delight people in their 20s to those born in the 1920s. Dont miss this unique show!



Faces for Radio: A Live Radio Play

Saturday, February 22nd at 8pm

Tickets are $10. Every tickets comes with a hot dog.

description:
Get ready for short form (Whose Line is it Anyway?) improv at the Push Comedy Theater.

You demanded it! So now it's here!!! Our very own short form improv show. All the fun of Whose Line is it Anyway... right here in Norfolk.

The Pushers are Virginia's premiere sketch and improv comedy group. For nearly ten years they have thrilled (and shocked) audiences with their wild antics both on and off stage. The group puts on a racy, high-octane, energetic show that is guaranteed to have audiences howling with laughter. In November of 2014, they opened The Push Comedy Theater, located in the Norfolk Arts District.

In 2013 The Pushers' Off-Broadway musical Cuff Me: The Unauthorized Fifty Shades of Grey Musical Parody debuted in New York City. It ran for over a year in both New York and Chicago. A third production is currently touring the country.

The Pushers have appeared at both The Charleston Comedy Festival and The North Carolina Comedy Arts Festival. In New York, they have performed at The People's Improv Theater, The Upright Citizen's Brigade and at The Kraine Theater in New York's East Village.

Here in Hampton Roads the group have performed most notably at The Jewish Mother, The NorVa and The Virginia Beach Funnybone.

title: Date Night: An Improvised Story of Love
description:
Get ready as we improvise your relationship.

It's the most fun you'll ever have on date night!

Two lucky couples will see their love unfold on stage through the interpretation of 2 of Hampton Roads' wackiest improvisers!

The couples will be selected at random and interviewed on stage in front of the audience. Using the information they learn, and their imagination, Brad and Alba will show the story of the couples' love.

For years, The Pushers have been getting to know diverse couples all across Hampton Roads with this signature piece. Normally this is a piece within a larger show. This time, Brad and Alba are out to explore as much as possible by bringing it to you as its own show!



Date Night: An Improvised Story of Love

First Friday of the Month at 8:00 PM

Tickets are $13. Each ticket comes with a hot dog.
